body.p: Which one of the following is the best password?

response.feedback: This is not a strong password since "spork" is a word (although a weird word, it must be said), it is short, and the digit-at-end pattern is common.
The misspelling of "spork" is better than a plain word, but this password is short at just 6 letters. Strong passwords are longer.
This is strong because it is not a word, includes nonalphabet characters, and is sufficiently long.
"Sesame" is not a strong password since it is the password from the famous tale of Ali Baba. Hackers know to guess such password puns. Avoid this sort of cleverness.
